djf

Class AppTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • djf.AppTemplate

  • public abstract class AppTemplate
extends javafx.application.Application
    This is the framework's JavaFX application. It provides the start method that begins the program initialization, which delegates component initialization to the application-specific child class' hook function.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void buildAppComponentsHook()
      This function must be overridden, it should initialize all of the components used by the app in the proper order according to the particular app's dependencies.

      Loads this application's properties file, which has a number of settings for initializing the user interface.
      void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This is where our Application begins its initialization, it will load the custom app properties, build the components, and fully initialize everything to get the app rolling.

    • Method Detail

      • buildAppComponentsHook

        public abstract void buildAppComponentsHook()
        This function must be overridden, it should initialize all of the components used by the app in the proper order according to the particular app's dependencies.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This is where our Application begins its initialization, it will load the custom app properties, build the components, and fully initialize everything to get the app rolling.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - This application's window.

      • loadProperties

        public boolean loadProperties(java.lang.String propertiesFileName)
        Loads this application's properties file, which has a number of settings for initializing the user interface.
        Parameters:
        propertiesFileName - The XML file containing properties to be loaded in order to initialize the UI.
        Returns:
        true if the properties file was loaded successfully, false otherwise.
